frameDefinitions: A Resisting_entity is capable of resisting or does resist a physical Opposing_force to a level specified by the target.
In this frame a Patient changes its consistency.
This frame contains words for motions or actions an Agent performs using some part of his/her body.
This Frame is concerned with evaluating an Evaluee as being suitable for a Purpose or a User, presupposing some choice that is being made about which Evaluee to use for the Purpose or User.
A Theme moves with respect to a Fixed_location, generally with a certain Periodicity, without undergoing unbounded translational motion or significant alteration of configuration/shape.
In this frame a Patient undergoes a change of phase.
frameExamples: The great and <t>impregnable</t> fortress still stands today.
(1) We need to build more houses <t>suitable</t> for local residents.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> is the item that resists the <fen>Opposing_force</fen> to the level specified by the target.

The <fen>Opposing_force</fen> is the item placed in opposition to the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen>. <fen>Opposing_force</fen> hinders, blocks, helps, or allows (lets) the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> to resist at the level specified by the target. Sometimes this Core role is incorporated in the target; otherwise, it is often null instantiated in example sentences.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
The location where the <fen>Resisting_entity</fen> resists an external force.
<fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that undergoes a change.
When the <fen>Patient</fen> changes consistency.
Where the the <fen>Patient</fen> changes consistency.
The <fen>Agent</fen> uses some part of his/her body to perform the action. <fen>Agent</fen> occurs as the External Argument.
With some verbs in this frame, the <fen>Body_part</fen> involved in the action is specified by the meaning of the verb and cannot be expressed separately.  For example,
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the body movement occurs.
The location within which the movement of a <fen>Body_part</fen> takes place.
This Frame Element marks constituents expressing the entity that is judged to be more or less suitable for some <fen>Purpose</fen> or <fen>User</fen>.
This Frame Element marks constituents that express the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged to be suitable or unsuitable.
This role marks expressions that indicate a <fen>User</fen> to whom
A physical entity that is participating in non-translational motion.
The time at which the <fen>Theme</fen> is in bounded motion.
The location where the bounded motion happens.
<fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that undergoes a change of phase.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Patient</fen> changes phase.
Where the <fen>Patient</fen> changes phase.
listRoleExamples: These are made from a tough <fex>plastic foam</fex> and are very light to wear.
The fortress was impregnable <fex>to attack by hostile invaders</fex>.
The retaining wall was even weaker <fex>yesterday</fex>, and had begun to crumble.
They decided the tree-house would be sturdiest <fex>in the big old backyard oak</fex>.
There was singing for joy in the streets, and <fex>everywhere</fex> people lifting their arms into the air.
Being a project leader is not a job for which <fex>everybody</fex> is suited.
We need to plan more buildings suitable <fex>for disabled people</fex>.
